Repeating Sampling from a Tibble

Source: R/rep_sample_n.R
rep_sample_n.Rd

Repeating Sampling from a Tibble

rep_sample_n(tbl, size, replace = FALSE, reps = 1)

Arguments

tbl

tbl of data.
size

The number of rows to select.
replace

Sample with or without replacement?
reps

The number of samples to collect.

Value

A tbl_df that aggregates all created samples, with the addition of a replicate column that the tbl_df is also grouped by

Examples

data(nc)
rep_sample_n(nc, size=10, replace=FALSE, reps=1)

#> # A tibble: 10 x 14
#> # Groups:   replicate [1]
#>    replicate  fage  mage mature weeks premie visits marital gained weight
#>        <int> <int> <int> <fct>  <int> <fct>   <int> <fct>    <int>  <dbl>
#>  1         1    38    34 young…    36 premie      7 not ma…     22   6.31
#>  2         1    NA    25 young…    39 full …     12 not ma…     41   6.88
#>  3         1    26    24 young…    39 full …     14 not ma…     36   7.63
#>  4         1    22    20 young…    37 full …      8 married     27   6.69
#>  5         1    NA    32 young…    33 premie     10 not ma…     60   5.06
#>  6         1    35    33 young…    37 full …     15 not ma…     30   7.5 
#>  7         1    20    23 young…    39 full …     15 not ma…     56   7.31
#>  8         1    42    31 young…    39 full …     12 not ma…     34   7.88
#>  9         1    44    38 matur…    41 full …     15 not ma…     37   7.75
#> 10         1    22    21 young…    40 full …     15 married     22   6.94
#> # … with 4 more variables: lowbirthweight <fct>, gender <fct>, habit <fct>,
#> #   whitemom <fct>
